wikipedia_page.main: Patrick Eagar (born 1944) is a British cricket photographer, who took photos at 325 Test matches, including 98 Ashes Test matches, between 1965 and 2011.

response: *An Australian Summer: The Recovery of the Ashes 1985 (Kingswood Press, 1985), with Patrick Eagar

In the Third Test at Trent Bridge he mixed with the crowd and read a newspaper in the stands; "Matthews of the petit-punk hair and puppet movements...has a happy knack of winding up crowds".p61, Alan Ross/ Patrick Eagar, An Australian Summer, The Kingswood Press, 1985,
* An Eye for Cricket (with Patrick Eagar) (1979)
The cricket photographer Patrick Eagar is his son.Wisden Cricketer's Almanack, 1978 edition, Obituaries in 1977
